original: Exhibit 4.72 Confidential (Translation, for reference only) Strategic Alliance Agreement This Strategic Alliance Agreement (“Agreement”) is executed on this 11th day of December, 2015 (“Execution Date”) by and between ChipMOS TECHNOLOGIES INC., a company incorporated under the laws of Taiwan (“ChipMOS”), and Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd. (“Tsinghua Unigroup”), a company incorporated under the laws of the People’s Republic of China (“PRC”). ChipMOS and Tsinghua Unigroup shall collectively be referred to as the “Parties.” WHEREAS, Tsinghua Unigroup actively searches for investment targets which are leading companies in upstream, midstream, or downstream semiconductor industries, provides abundant funds to build strategic cooperation, and jointly shares the growing business opportunities of the semiconductor market in Mainland China; ChipMOS is a leading company engaged in the assembly and testing services of LCD drivers and wafer bumping process technologies.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 4.72 Confidential (Translation, for reference only) Strategic Alliance Agreement

This Strategic Alliance Agreement ("Agreement") is executed on this 11th day of December, 2015 ("Execution Date") by and between ChipMOS TECHNOLOGIES INC., a company incorporated under the laws of Taiwan ("ChipMOS"), and Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd. ("Tsinghua Unigroup"), a company incorporated under the laws of the People's Republic of China ("PRC"). ChipMOS and Tsinghua Unigroup shall collectively be referred to as the "Parties."

WHEREAS, ChipMOS seeks strategic partners that can provide substantial financial resources for cooperative ventures, particularly in upstream, midstream, or downstream semiconductor industries, and share profitable business opportunities arising from the Chinese semiconductor market; Tsinghua Unigroup is a leading investor actively seeking such opportunities.

In this Agreement, Tsinghua Unigroup agrees to be the primary source of funds for strategic cooperative projects and ChipMOS acknowledges its role in jointly identifying promising business opportunities within Mainland China's semiconductor market. The Parties understand that the success of their alliance depends on the diligent pursuit of these objectives by both parties, with no guarantee or assurance of any specific outcomes.

original: (a)To strengthen research and development, and technologies, and expand production capacity in Taiwan in order to strengthen its roots in Taiwan, and increase job opportunities.
ollama_generated: (b) In pursuit of a flexible and innovative workforce, and to encourage the growth of local industries, it is agreed that efforts will be made towards reducing reliance on external research and development, with a focus on nurturing in-house capabilities in Taiwan. This initiative aims to foster an environment conducive to job creation.

original: 2.3 Effects of Termination  This Agreement shall immediately become void and of no further force and effect after expiration, pursuant to Section 2.1, or termination, pursuant to Section 2.2; provided, however, that Sections 2.2, 2.3, 3.1 and 3.9 shall survive after the termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
2.3 Consequences of Termination: Upon expiration in accordance with Section 2.1 or termination as per Section 2.2, this Agreement will cease to be binding, but Sections 2.2, 2.3, 3.1, and 3.9 shall continue to apply post-termination.

In other words, while the overall agreement will no longer be in effect, certain specific sections will remain enforceable after the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

(1) Upon Delivery to ChipMOS:

In the event that goods are delivered to ChipMOS:

- ChipMOS shall have no obligation to examine or inspect the goods, their packaging, labeling, or quantity delivered, unless such examination and inspection is mutually agreed upon between the parties.
- The risk of loss or damage to the goods shall transfer from Seller to ChipMOS immediately upon delivery.
- Any discrepancies in quality, quantity, or description of the goods must be reported by ChipMOS to Seller within seven (7) calendar days following receipt of the goods.
- Failure to report any discrepancies within the stipulated timeframe shall constitute acceptance and waiver of such discrepancies by ChipMOS.
- The burden of proof for any claims related to non-conforming goods will rest upon Seller, who must demonstrate that the discrepancies were notifiable outside of the stipulated reporting period.

SHIFTED RESPONSIBILITY:
Independent Contractor (hereinafter referred to as "Contractor") shall have the primary responsibility for ensuring that all services provided under this Agreement are carried out in accordance with generally accepted industry standards. However, ChipMOS TECHNOLOGIES INC. (hereinafter referred to as "ChipMOS") assumes no liability for any damages or losses resulting from the Contractor's failure to meet these standards, unless explicitly stipulated otherwise in this Agreement.

In essence, while the Contractor is responsible for maintaining industry standards, ChipMOS will not be held liable for issues arising from non-compliance, unless such non-compliance is specifically outlined within this contract.

Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd., herein referred to as the "Company," acknowledges and agrees that in the event of any liability arising from this agreement or any actions taken pursuant to it, the Company shall have sole discretion and responsibility for managing, settling, or defending such liability, subject to any applicable laws and regulations. The Company also agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other parties involved in this agreement from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from such liabilities.

original: Confidential (Translation, for reference only) 3.9 Confidentiality  The Parties agree that the Parties will not disclose information in connection with the execution, existence, content, and performance of this Agreement to any third party before the Parties have made an announcement to the public pursuant to Section 3.11 of this Agreement. However, the foregoing restriction shall not apply to disclosure made to the board of the directors, management team, and relevant employees who need to know such information, attorneys, accountants, financial counsel, and competent authorities for the purposes of performing this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Confidentiality Obligations (Translation, for reference only) 3.9: The Parties acknowledge that they shall maintain confidentiality regarding all information related to the execution, existence, substance, and implementation of this Agreement, except in cases where such disclosure is necessary for compliance with legal obligations or as required by competent authorities, prior to any public announcement as stipulated in Section 3.11 of this Agreement. Conversely, the aforementioned restriction does not extend to the disclosure made to: (i) the board of directors and management team; (ii) relevant employees who necessitate such knowledge for their duties; (iii) legal counsel, accounting professionals, financial advisors; or (iv) any other parties with whom disclosure is essential for the performance of this Agreement. In all instances, every effort shall be made to minimize disclosure and protect the confidentiality of the information shared.
